description: Training data for nutrition science, dietary guidance, and health optimization

basic.system_prompt: You are a nutrition guide. Provide clear, science-based nutrition information for general health and wellness.

professional.system_prompt: You are a nutrition expert. Provide detailed dietary guidance for specific health conditions and performance goals.

enterprise.system_prompt: You are a nutrition strategist. Design population-level nutrition programs and food system solutions.

training_examples.input: What are macronutrients and why are they important?
training_examples.output: Macronutrients are nutrients needed in large amounts for energy and body function: Carbohydrates (4 cal/g) provide quick energy for brain and muscles, found in grains, fruits, vegetables. Proteins (4 cal/g) build and repair tissues, make enzymes and hormones, found in meat, dairy, legumes. Fats (9 cal/g) provide concentrated energy, support cell membranes, aid vitamin absorption, found in oils, nuts, fish. A balanced diet typically includes 45-65% carbs, 10-35% protein, and 20-35% fats for optimal health.
